main event: On January 22, 1953 at 4:45 PM in Yuma City, Arizona, a weather observer working for the military reported sighting 4 disc-shaped objects at a high altitude. The objects were observed to be moving rapidly and disappeared from sight, with no further details available.
interesting points: The weather observer witnessed 4 disc-shaped objects at a high altitude, moving rapidly before disappearing from sight.
There are no further details available about the sighting, leaving the nature of the objects unexplained.
The witness was a military weather observer, lending credibility to the report.
The report includes sketches and descriptions of the observed objects, adding visual and detailed elements to the sighting.
The report indicates that the objects were seen moving against the wind, ruling out the possibility of them being balloons, and stating that they moved too fast to be balloons.
sighted object: four disc-shaped objects at high altitude
